intro: Erigeron sparsifolius, commonly known as the sparseleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has slender stems and small, linear leaves that are spaced apart, giving it a sparse appearance. The flowers bloom in the summer, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
